This 202m² property offers the perfect holiday home or investment opportunity at €495,000—an exceptional value when you consider it's priced 40% below comparable properties in other Spanish island markets. Whether you're seeking a sunshine retreat for family getaways or a second home that generates rental income, this penthouse delivers both lifestyle and financial returns. Santa Pola's golden beaches, welcoming expat community, and year-round Mediterranean climate make it an increasingly popular destination for international buyers looking to escape the ordinary. areaSection: Santa Pola is a charming coastal town in southern Alicante, nestled between pristine beaches and natural parkland. Located just 25 minutes from Alicante Airport, this strategic location makes it accessible yet peaceful, away from the tourist crowds of larger resorts. The town boasts a rich maritime heritage, authentic Spanish culture, and a thriving international community that has evolved over the past two decades. Santa Pola's microclimate offers over 300 days of sunshine annually, with mild winters perfect for extended holiday stays. The town has invested heavily in infrastructure and amenities, making it a preferred choice for discerning buyers seeking authentic Costa Blanca living. From the charming old town with its tapas bars to modern beachfront developments, Santa Pola perfectly balances traditional Spanish charm with contemporary comfort.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in Santa Pola centers around the beach, local markets, and a relaxed Mediterranean rhythm that feels far removed from busy city living. Mornings begin with café con leche at a beachfront chiringuito, while afternoons are spent exploring the multiple Blue Flag beaches or wandering through the bustling weekly markets where local produce and fresh seafood feature prominently. The established expat community means English is widely spoken, yet authentic Spanish culture remains at the heart of the town. Dining options range from family-run paella restaurants to contemporary Mediterranean cuisine, with most restaurants offering fresh catch from the morning's boats. Healthcare is reliable and accessible, with English-speaking doctors in private clinics and a regional hospital minutes away. The town attracts like-minded international residents who value quality of life over nightlife, making it ideal for families and retirees seeking their holiday base.
investmentSection: Santa Pola's property market is experiencing strong growth, with prices rising 8% year-on-year—outpacing broader Costa Blanca trends. This penthouse at €2,450/m² represents premium value, particularly when compared to similar properties in other Spanish coastal markets that command significantly higher premiums. Holiday rental demand remains consistently strong, with comparable properties in the area generating approximately €800 per week during peak season, translating to solid annual returns for property owners. Santa Pola's appeal to both European holiday makers and long-term retirees creates a diverse rental market. The town's continued investment in infrastructure, combined with its established international community and authentic Spanish character, positions it well for sustained property value appreciation. Whether purchased as a personal retreat or investment asset, this property offers both lifestyle benefits and financial potential.

At €495,000, you're not just purchasing a property—you're investing in a lifestyle, a location with proven appreciation potential, and a genuine income-generating asset. lifeAndAmenities.intro: Santa Pola offers all the conveniences of modern living while maintaining its authentic Mediterranean character. Daily necessities, quality healthcare, education options, and excellent transport connections make it a fully functional seaside community.

healthcare.text: Healthcare in Santa Pola meets high international standards with both public and private options readily available. The regional hospital is conveniently located approximately 30 minutes away and provides comprehensive emergency services, specialist departments, and surgical facilities. Multiple private clinics throughout Santa Pola offer immediate access to English-speaking doctors and specialists, reducing wait times for consultations and treatments. Pharmacies are plentiful and well-stocked with medications, many available without prescription that would require prescriptions elsewhere. The established expat community has led to development of healthcare services specifically catering to international residents, ensuring cultural and language compatibility.

education.text: Santa Pola and surrounding areas offer quality education options suitable for international families. The International School of Elche, located 25 minutes away, provides British curriculum education with a strong reputation for academic excellence and pastoral care. Spanish public schools are also available for families seeking local integration, with many teachers in coastal areas experienced in supporting international students. Private international schools in nearby Alicante offer alternative British, American, and Spanish curricula. The region's educational infrastructure reflects the established expat community, with schools accustomed to supporting families relocating from abroad.

shopping.text: Shopping in Santa Pola ranges from modern supermarkets to authentic weekly markets brimming with local produce and fresh seafood. Mercadona, Lidl, and Consum supermarkets provide familiar international products alongside Spanish specialties at competitive prices. The weekly Friday market offers fresh vegetables, local fish, and artisanal goods at excellent value. Central Santa Pola features independent shops, boutiques, and restaurants reflecting local character. For major shopping needs, Alicante city center—30 minutes away—offers large shopping centers with international brands and department stores.

transport.text: Santa Pola's location provides excellent transport connectivity for both daily living and travel. Alicante Airport—Spain's third-busiest—is just 25 minutes away with direct flights to major UK cities year-round, making regular trips home convenient and affordable. Public bus services connect Santa Pola to Alicante city, neighboring towns, and regional destinations. While a car provides optimal flexibility for exploring the broader Costa Blanca, many residents live comfortably using buses for regular needs and taxis for evening outings. The coastal location means scenic driving through Mediterranean landscapes when exploring beyond the immediate area.

faqs.question: Combien coûte ce bien immobilier ?
faqs.answer: €495,000. This 3-bedroom, 2-bathroom penthouse spans 202m² and represents exceptional value at €2,450/m²—40% below comparable properties in other Spanish markets. The price includes premium construction standards and an optimal beach location in Santa Pola.

faqs.question: La Costa Blanca est-elle un bon endroit pour acheter un bien immobilier ?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca is an excellent property investment destination. The region experiences consistent 8% annual property value growth, benefits from established international communities, offers strong holiday rental demand, and provides year-round sunshine with over 300 days annually. Santa Pola specifically has become increasingly popular due to its balance of authentic Spanish character and modern amenities.

faqs.question: Les étrangers peuvent-ils acheter un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can purchase property in Spain without restrictions. Non-EU citizens will need an NIE (Spanish tax identification number), and while some regions have restrictions on property purchases, Alicante and Santa Pola have no such limitations. Professional legal advisors can guide you through the straightforward documentation process.

faqs.question: Quels sont les frais d'achat d'un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect approximately 8-10% additional costs including transfer tax (6-8%), notary fees (0.5%), registry fees (0.5%), and legal costs (1%). Some regions have different tax rates. These costs are one-time expenses at purchase. Les taxes foncières annuelles are minimal—typically 0.4-1.1% of cadastral value.

faqs.question: Quel est le coût de la vie sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca's cost of living is approximately 20-30% lower than northern Europe while maintaining comparable quality. Monthly expenses for a couple average €1,500-2,000 including rent, utilities, food, and entertainment. Santa Pola offers particular value due to its local character, with fresh produce from weekly markets and affordable Spanish dining options.

faqs.question: Puis-je obtenir un prêt hypothécaire en Espagne en tant qu'étranger ?
faqs.answer: Yes, many Spanish banks and international lenders offer mortgages to foreign buyers. Typically, you can obtain financing for 70-80% of the property value with an NIE number and proof of income. EU citizens have easier access to mortgages, while non-EU citizens may require additional documentation. Professional mortgage advisors can navigate lender requirements.

faqs.question: La Costa Blanca est-elle adaptée aux retraités ?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca is excellent for retirees, particularly Santa Pola. The established international community provides social networks and support systems. Healthcare is reliable and affordable, with English-speaking doctors available. The climate eliminates harsh winters, and the cost of living is lower than most Northern European countries, stretching retirement income further.

faqs.question: Quel temps fait-il sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Santa Pola enjoys Mediterranean weather with over 300 days of sunshine annually. Summers (June-September) average 28-30°C with minimal rainfall, while winters (December-February) remain mild at 10-15°C. Spring and autumn offer perfect conditions of 20-25°C. This climate makes it ideal for outdoor living and water activities throughout the year.

faqs.question: À quelle distance se trouve la Costa Blanca de la France ?
faqs.answer: Santa Pola is approximately 1,400km (870 miles) from London. Alicante Airport—25 minutes from this property—offers direct flights to most major UK cities, with flight times of approximately 2.5-3 hours. Budget airlines provide competitive pricing, making frequent visits to the UK from your holiday home very affordable.

faqs.question: What rental income can I expect from a holiday property in Santa Pola?
faqs.answer: This property can typically generate €800 per week during peak summer season (June-August) and €400-600 during shoulder months (April-May, September-October). Winter months generate €300-400. Professional rental management companies handle bookings, cleaning, and maintenance, taking a percentage (typically 20-30%) of rental revenue. Annual gross rental income for this property could reasonably exceed €25,000.
